body.p:
Newport Ky
March 10th 1864
His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette
Gov. of Kentucky
Dr Sir

In the winter or Spring of 1852, I went on a bail bond for Samuel Ganow, in the Grant Circuit Court to the amount of $125. The recognizance was forfeited & Judgment renered against me. Ganow resided in Ohio, & I learn, died about the time he should have appeared. Whether before or after I am not able to say.

My recollection is that the judgment was remitted by Gov. Powell about shortly after it was rendered but I have no written evidence of it. The Commonwealth's Attorney I know recommended the remission However the matter has slept until the present time, & recently an Execution has been issued against me for the $125. credited by $25 paid by me, at the interest of the Attorney for the Commonwealth which is now in the hands of
the Sheriff of Campbell County
It would oppress me seriously to pay it now & I never received any indemnity against it from any one.
I ask therefore that it may be remitted by the Executive
The Judgment was rendered at the April Term 1854 of the Grant Circuit Court
Under the circumstances of the above case I would recommend the remission prayed on by Mr. Hallam.
So do I Guy Atsman Clk Cir Ct
and so do I Sidney B. Jones D.S.CC
I recommend the remission asked for in the petition

Oliver W. Root County Atty for Campbell --
J. Hawthorn

Grant Cir Ct
vs
Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
Jas R Hallam
$125 --
Forfeiture
14th Mch 1864
